intro: Rhysolepis anchusifolia, commonly known as the anchusifoliate rhyolepis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
